intro: Valerianella morisonii var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited valerian, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its fruits are distinctive, being large, inflated capsules that split open to release seeds. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
